parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Animations </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the name of a unit's current primary animation. Seems to be forced to lower case in Arma 3.<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>This command is only for a man unit, other units such as animals cannot use this command.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''animationState''' unitName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_state = [[animationState]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name> mp </name>=<value> When executed on a client, this command only returns accurate results when the target unit is within sight of the client. When executed on a dedicated server, the returned value is accurate. </value></part><part><name/>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[switchMove]], [[playMove]], [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnimGetParams]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on August 22, 2014 - 23:30</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5| ffur2007slx2_5]]</dt>
<dd class="note">(A3 1.26) To sort animation state by keyword, use [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnimGetParams]]
<code> ("KNEEL" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnimGetParams]]) [[select]] 0;
//return: ["amovpknlmstpslowwrfldnon"…]</code>
Useful keywords are: "STAND", "WATCH", "GUARD", "LISTEN_BRIEFING", "LEAN_ON_TABLE", "LEAN", "SIT_AT_TABLE", "KNEEL", "PRONE_INJURED", "BRIEFING" ect.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Take On Helicopters|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 13, 2019 - 07:44 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:POLPOX|POLPOX]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In case you need to get the animation name including upper cases:
<code>[[configName]] ([[configFile]] >> [[getText]] ([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles" >> [[typeOf]] _unit >> "moves") >> "States" >> ([[animationState]] _unit)) //e.g. "AmovPercMstpSrasWrflDnon"</code>
Opposite to regular animationState return value:
<code>[[animationState]] _unit //e.g. "amovpercmstpsraswrfldnon"</code>
</dd>
</dl>
